list_definition.definition: of a dark colour/color between red and yellow

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She was very brown after her holiday in Greece.

list_definition.definition: (any shade of) a colour/color similar to toasted bread, tanned skin, coffee etc.
something (eg paint, polish etc) brown in colour/color.

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Brown the meat in a pan
Her face had been browned by the sun.

list_ex_of_english: She said that nobody listens to what the railway-men say, that the railway workers are "browned off", and so on.
Mesonotum : integument and scales dark brown, the scales rather narrow.
They were "browned off" and were only there because they had to be.
Farmers also selected brown-seeded tef, but for home consumption.
They share the colourful appearance of those groups with blues and browns predominating.
The species tend towards dull grays and browns in their appearance.
Mesonotal integument dark brown, with a pair of submedian paler lines, with dark brown, small, narrow curved scales.
Many of the students are browned off with hostel accommodation.
